intro: Erigeron pazensis, commonly known as the Mexican fleabane, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in open, sunny habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. Its flowers are usually pale blue to white, with ray florets that give it a daisy-like appearance. Erigeron pazensis is often found in the Sierra Madre mountain ranges and is adapted to dry, arid environments.
